page.title: 11 FARMING CALENDAR
page.content: AUTUMN:PREPARATION of fields to be cultivated(muck spreading;ploughing; harrowing).Winter wheat and barley sown.Animals brought in when grass stops growing;surplus stock to market. WINTER:Early lambing in December and January.Repairs to machinery,hedges and other equipment. SPRING:Late lambing.Spring cereals and potatoes PLANTED.Fat lambs sent to abattoir at Banbury. SUMMER:Spraying and irrigating(when dry) in early growth period.In June the sheep are shorn and the fleeces sent to wool marketing board.Also the sheep are dipped. Grass is collected for hay and silage,which is used as fodder. HARVESTING takes place in August and September of cereals and potatoes. These are mostly for sale apart from the maize which is used for fodder.
